Posts.Content: rackie wrote: i am starting chemo on thursday.  the combo is FEC-T.  i am really nervous but happy to be starting a regime.  i know i will loose my hair and i have purchased a wig.  i have a very weak stomach to begin with, so i am worried about how sick i will be.  they are also giving me neulasta for wbc.  can anyone share their experience with this therapy?  any tips on how to handle it? thanks jackie Dx 5/28/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/9 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: anyone have FEC-T chemo rackie carofin

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2010 11:53AM rackie wrote: thanks.  that is how i feel.  give me anything and everything possible, because i am ready to take this on and get on my life:)  i really apreciate all your input.  jackie
Posts.Title: anyone have FEC-T chemo rackie carofin

Posts.Content: rackie wrote: has anyone ever had, or bought their prosthetics form new attitude?  they sound very good, but i was just wondering about the cost.  i live in canada and the government covers a certain portion of the cost per/prosthetic and my husband's plan supposedly picks up over and above.  not sure which way to go, but pretty confident that i do not want reconstruction. thanks for your help. jackie Dx 5/28/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/9 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: custom prosthesis rackie eileen1955

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2010 10:49AM rackie wrote: i have had the odd glassof beer or wine in betweenchemos.  i just try to stay away from being too close to the chemo days.   the head of my chemo classes said that a drink or two is not going to hurt you.  just stay away from it the day before, day of and day after chemo. jackie
Posts.Title: alcohol and chemo? Carrol2 Shrek4

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 04:55PM rackie wrote: well guys, my operation got postponed untill jan 12th.  first the radioactive dye was still in me from the muga, so they could not do a snb, secondly i went to the family dr and i have very bad bronchitis and am treating it with antibiotics and puffer.  oh well i'll try again next wed.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2011 04:59PM rackie wrote: wonderful newss sonnet!  i had my bmx on 1/12 and toronto was getting snowed in as well! i have three drains and they are a royal pain!  i slightly ripped one today and the home care nurse had to come in and fix it up.  i still have lots of fluid in the breasts. jackie goodluck to those of you having your surgery this week:)
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 10:36PM rackie wrote: thanks everyone!  i am really scared, but anxious to finally have it over with.  on the plus side i will not need anymore mammos or breast mri's.  everyotime i had one, they were questionable.  thanks for all your words of encouragement.  tomorrow i have to go for a muga and then wed. i go for for the bmx. jackie

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2011 11:12AM rackie wrote: omg.  i am gettting really scared about tomorrow!
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 06:32PM rackie wrote: ladies i had my first bmx, right node dissection and left snb on jan 12.  pathology came back that the cancer in both breasts was gone and no more nodes on the right had any cancer.  on the snb, one node had less than a quarter of a mm microscopic cancer cell.  the dr, did not recommend more surgery, but said it was my choice.  so on tuesday i had my left lymphnode dissection.  i am in more pain with this surgery than the first.  i have seen my flat chest and scars and surprisingly it does not upset me.  the scars are very thin and clean looking.  i am not sure if i am going for reconsrtructiuon.  i am kind of sick of surgeries right now.  i will be starting rads in march.  i will get the pathology report on these nodes on march 1 and than i go for mapping the following week.  this has been a living hell since june of last year.  i feel like i have been hit by a mack truck.  i am very emotional.  i cry A LOT! i worry a lot.  as someone said earlier, i would just love to fast forward to a year from now.  i hope that i can get these emotions under control soon.  i have been given some anti anxiety pills, but i don't want to become dependent upon them.  oh well take care everyone:) jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 06:11PM rackie wrote: mdg, that is too funny!  i too am 45 and feel the same way!
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 11:00AM rackie wrote: add me to your thread!!!  i am having a bmx on jan 5th.  can't wait for it to be over and done with.  having lymphnode dissection on right side, sentinel node on left and possibly more if it shows positive. jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 11:20AM rackie wrote: alice hope you get better soon.  one of my right drains keeps on leaking.  now i need home care to come by again today:(.  i stiull have fluid in both breasts.  pain is not too bad. best wishes to all those having their surgeries this week. jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 06:02PM rackie wrote: oh thrmine, that is so sweet.  i am actually crying!  i know exactly how you feel.  my drains are annoying and i still have lots of fuid under the skin.  i am still bald, eyebrowless and eyelashless, now also boobless.  i have been feeling really down today.  it is raining and grey here.  it is when i see my kids, i know i have reason to be going through all of this.  once my surgery has healed i need radiation, but by the summer i hope to be myself again. (with some changes)lol!  i want to take my family on a nice holiday when this is all over! chemo was no picnic, but it is doable (really!)  i have the weakest stomach in the world and i did not get sick on chemo.  i was tired and i had a lot of muscle and joint aches.  those of you about to start chemo, you can do it and it is additional protection against getting this terrible disease again! jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 06:14PM rackie wrote: mdg, i have already had my chemo and surgery, now i am awaiting radiation.  i spent a good part of the day crying and i don;t want my kids to see it.  i find that i cry alot, especially since the surgery:(  i want to go back to my oldself, when i was not filled with so much anxiety.  you are right bc does suck!  i am not getting immediate reconstruction because i need to have rads.  i am so sick of surgery, twice in three weeks!  so i won't be rushing in for reconstruction.  i did go oput to buy a pair of foobs yesterday.  that was kind of weird, but they do make the clothes look better.  like you, i want to be done with all of this soon! jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2011 07:45PM rackie wrote: hi ladies.  i came home yesterday from the hospital.  i  have home care coming by to change the dressings and look at the drains.  i am not doing too bad.  i have some fluid build up in the left breast, but not too much.  the drains are a pain!  they keep on getting in my way.  sleeping is not the best.  i have to lay on my back and put pillows on the sides to elevate my arms.  this was not the most comfortable sleep!  i am so happy it is over.  i see my surgeon again on feb 1.  wishing all you other ladies the best for your upcoming surgeries!
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 08:59AM rackie wrote: hi redsky i am so sorry to hear of youur delays.  my first surgery was rescheduled to an error ht edr made.  he told me i could have my muga scan the day before surgery no problem (even though i was getting a blue dye for the snb).  had muga scan and raiologist said can't have surgery because the muga will hide the snb tracer.  dr said to come in and he will run a geiger on me to see if i have too much radioactivity.  surprise surprise, he could not do the surgery (it was best because i had a reeally bad cough and cold at the time).  the anesthetist said it would only be cancelled if i had a fever or really severe cough.  anyway, i had my suregery one week later and it was hell waiting. then i had a second surgery last tues, because they found a microscopic cell in one sentinel node.  i opted for more node removal, becasue i would never rest knowing i left it.  i know that recent studies have indicated that further surgery is not needed, but mentally i had to do it.  today i just had one drain removed and hopefully the other one on friday:)  redsky, you will feeel better when this is all behind you:) jackie
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC
